reviewText:
No, don't try this. It is not a Photo Hunt game. This game is completable on its own without paying money but there is definitely a Pay To Win element. For $100, get 100 Gold Tokens to purchase more abilities to clear the game. I've played the other versions of these type of games and they are all the same. This game was probably ported over from Facebook.

PROS
1. Simple
Look for 4 to 7 items in a room. Only the 7th item is tough to find.

2. Size
Less than 100 MB. Fast to download.

CONS
1. Grinding
You actually have to play the same room over and over again. There are 3 modes, Word mode, Silhouette mode and Night mode. In Word mode, you look for the object matching a word. In Silhouette mode, you look for the object that looks like its shadow. In Night mode, everything is dark and you search with flashlight.

2. Boring
The items are mixed around in the same few locations. It's so boring.

3. Asking for More Health from Your Friends
WTF? This is like Facebook all over again.

reviewText:
THis game, well it's like so many other games that appeared on facebook, because it uses facebook mechanics.  That means you need to add friends to send you energy and health and all that other gubbins, to enable you to playy some more, and then you'd send them energy and health packs, to allow them t play some more.  On top of this there is monetisation/microtansactions, to enable you to get more items to unlock things sooner etc.

It's not my sort of game because of those very reasons, though I usually like hidden object type games.

I'm giving it a thumb's down because while it does look nice I've seen better.  I've been sat ehre thinking 'Wtf is that thing supposed to be?' even after it's been collected successfully.  So it does nothing to stand out fromt eh crowd, and it's dependence on the whole 'social' aspects weigh it down.  I'd recommend looking elsewhere if you want a hidden object fix.

reviewText:
In this game you play a man who is forced by Brendan Fraser to find items needed to open the entrance to the Center of the Earth. Little does Brendan know, he's actually sequencing a code for opening the door to The Rock's Scorpion mummy tomb. Even though he's getting negative Steam Reviews, he continues to hound players and force them to do his menial tasks. He even forces a 30 year old version of Jenny Weasely to help, most likely kidnapping her from Harry. The Cowboys from Brokeback Mountain even make an appearance. One of them is poisoned and you save him by picking up firewood and violins for Brendan. If only G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra and Pawn Shop Chronicles were good movies... If only he could still guest star on King of the Hill and Fairly Odd Parents... Maybe, just maybe, it wouldn't have come to this.

I recommend this game to people who want Brendan Fraser's weeny in their butt.

I do not recommend it for people who didn't like the Mummy because it's pretty much the same thing except you don't actually see The Scorpion Mummy Rock it's just implied.

reviewText:
Product received for free

So it has energy that has to replenish, which is a pain, but 2 min per isn't terrible? I'm only level 9 so I'm sure it gets worse since it takes more and more energy to do things. I'm having a problem right now where it won't let me into my room and it won't let me visit friends?

Story and reasoning is kind of off and there's some grammar mistakes, but not major. Set kind of like a facebook game if that matters to anyone.

It's not a bad game, but it isn't steller either. Not like I can complain when it was free though lol. It's alright.

EDIT: Game has microtransactions that are only avoidable for so long. By the end of the week it looks like I'll either have to buy gold or stop playing, and while the game is neat its not worth what they want for gold.

reviewText: I've been playing this game on Facebook so when I saw it coming out on steam, I immediately wanted to try it.  First off the gameplay is much faster on Steam (the loading times on FB drive me nuts!).  Of course the con is that you are starting over, there seems to be no place to enter your member ID# (hint, hint) and you have to find friends all over again to help you play.\nStill as a relative newbie to the game (I haven't reached level 30 yet on FB), I am willing to give this a chance and see where it leads.  Good or bad, I will update this review as I get more experience. I will also keep up my FB gameplay so that I have a bit of an edge on where the story is going.
